You're trying to say I'm mad.
No, no, not mad.
No, of course not. No.
But I tell you, I saw the Daleks. They were duplicating! I saw it! I swear to you!
He suddenly started saying these things in the lab. I'm afraid he's
Oh, no! No!
Keep him under restraint.
Oh, will nobody listen to me?!

Dialogue.Stage Direction: Polly sits on the floor, watching Valmar work on a power connector. A Dalek is watching them.

Dialogue.Line: Pass me that small screwdriver.
I can't. My hands are tied. Anyway, I wouldn't help you even if I could.
Okay.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: Kebble appears with more cable.

Dialogue.Line: More? I can't handle them.
This is the lot.
Listen. The Dalek's gone now.
That doesn't mean you can start talking.
Oh, leave her alone, Kebble. She isn't doing any harm.
You think you're very tough don't you, pushing a girl around. I'd like to see you come up against a real man.
Like who?
Like Ben, for instance.
Don't worry about him. We've got him safely stowed away.
You've got Ben?
He's sleeping off a slight fall.
I told you to leave her alone.
Your name's Valmar, isn't it?
That's it.
You want the Daleks to fight the Governor. But don't you see? They'll turn on you, too.
What? Three big pepper pots?
One of them did kill Resno. And you saw what the Dalek did to that sheet of metal.
And that's just the beginning.
Don't listen to her. She's giving you the Examiner's line.
He isn't the Examiner. We're just travellers, landed here by accident. The Doctor, that's the man you think is the Examiner, found the real Examiner dead and picked up his papers.
This Doctor of yours. He knows something about the Daleks?
He's tried to warn everyone. It's the only reason we stayed here.
When will the work be completed?
I don't know. I'll need a new junction box like this one.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: The Dalek leaves.

Dialogue.Line: You've all underestimated these Daleks.
Better brains than us, I suppose.
I only know what the Doctor has told me. He says they're capable of exterminating whole nations.
Perhaps, but what would they want to kill us for, after we've taken over. We're friendly with the Daleks.
But don't you see? Human beings can't be friends with Daleks. They don't have friends.
I don't see why not.
It's a kind of hatred for anything unlike themselves. They think they're superior.
The girl's got something.
You want to tell Janley, you're welcome.
Janley! She'll betray the lot of you, if she gets the chance.
The other junction box is outside.
Thank you.
Talk too much, don't you? Didn't you know he was soft on Janley? All right, all right, I'm just putting her straight.
More slack on the cables.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: A Dalek is laying a thick power cable along the wall. is draped over its sucker-stick. The Dalek detects the sounds of voices ahead. It turns back, and moves out of sight as two humans appear.

Dialogue.Line: What are all these cables lying about?
New emergency power supply.
Who's idea was that?
What do you want to know for?
What do I? Don't you know I'm the Governor? Where are you from?
The interior, sir.
The interior? Why are you carrying a gun?
I'm a Squad Leader in Bragen's guard, sir.
Oh, I see. Bragen's guard, ay? All right, carry on.
Cut that row out, you two.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: The Doctor plays his recorder as Quinn creeps out of his unlocked cell and pounces on the guard.

Dialogue.Line: What the? Oh!

Dialogue.Stage Direction: Quinn knocks the guard out then unlocks the Doctor's cell.

Dialogue.Line: Come on.
Wait a minute.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: They lock the guard in the cell after the Doctor removes the jug and glass of water.

Dialogue.Line: We don't want him trying it, although he seemed a bit tone deaf to me.
Well, Bragen, these trips are becoming more and more demanding.
I didn't expect you, Governor.
Oh, I had as much as I could stand. Well, what's been happening here?
One moment.
I asked you a question, man.
I heard you.
Look, your work can wait. You can hand over to me tomorrow. I want to hear about the Examiner.
The Examiner is at present in jail.
In jail? That's rather dangerous, isn't it? Who put him there?
I did.
You did? In heaven's sake, why?
He's an impostor, Governor. Possibly a murderer as well. We've just discovered the body of the real Examiner in the mercury swamp.
I hope you're sure of your facts, Bragen.
Quite sure.
This could have far reaching consequences.
As far as I am concerned, there's nothing more to be said. So if there's nothing further
Nothing further? Who the devil do you think you're talking to? Stand up when you're speaking to me, man!
I prefer to remain seated.
Do you now? We'll soon see about that. Guards! Take this man out of my office. Did you hear what I said? That's an order!
You forget, my dear Hensell. They're not your guards, they're mine.
I am the Governor.
No. Not now. I am.
Oh, I see. Your guards, ay? Yes, Quinn warned me about your guards, but we all took them too lightly, didn't we? But we'll soon change that.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: Hensell moves to the door, but guards block his way.

Dialogue.Line: You imbecile! How long do you think your handful of guards can hang out when the people hear that I am being kept a prisoner in my own capital?
The people will do exactly as they are told, Hensell. It will, of course, be easier for them if you co-operate with us.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: Bragen pushes a button on the desk, then motions for Hensell to take his seat. The Governor sits at his desk. Then a Dalek enters and stops next to Bragen.

Dialogue.Line: Wait there. Guards, dismissed.
So, Bragen, you want my cooperation, do you?
It would save bloodshed. I might even let you keep the title of Governor.
Might you now? I'll tell you what you will do. You'll order your guards to disarm and place yourself under arrest immediately!
So you reject my offer. I thought it a generous one in the circumstances.
What circumstances?
Look at this.
What is it?

Dialogue.Stage Direction: Bragen unwraps a Dalek gun-stick.

Dialogue.Line: The reason that the colony is now mine.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: Bragen attaches the gun-stick to the Dalek.

Dialogue.Line: Is it a weapon of some kind?
I'll arrange a demonstration for you. Do you still refuse my offer?
I will not be intimidated.
Of course not. In character to the last, Hensell. Kill him!

Dialogue.Stage Direction: The Dalek obeys.

Dialogue.Line: Why do human beings kill human beings?
Get on with your work.
Yes, master. I obey.
Yes, obey me! From now on, I'll have complete obedience from everyone!

Dialogue.Stage Direction: The Doctor and Quinn hide under a workbench. A Dalek comes out of the capsule, followed by Valmar.

Dialogue.Line: I'll have to check the cable circuit now. Otherwise it's just as you asked for.
Very well.
Why can't you carry on with the power you're drawing from the colony? Why go to all this trouble?
Until now, we have had to recharge from the colony supply. With static power, the Daleks will be twice as (pause) useful.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: Janley runs in.

Dialogue.Line: Valmar, quick!
What's the matter?
The Governor's back.
What about the girl?
Leave her.
I will follow you.
What for?
I am your servant.
Come on.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: Janley, Valmar and the Dalek leave. The Doctor and Quinn come out.

Dialogue.Line: An electrical circuit of their own supplying static electricity! I wonder how much longer we've got?
I didn't realise they'd have a circuit of their own.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: Kebble picks up a wrench.

Dialogue.Line: Doctor, look out!

Dialogue.Stage Direction: Quinn launches himself at Kebble, who feints and swings the wrench at Quinn's head. Quinn ducks and rolls to the workbench to get Lesterson's laser. He shoots Kebble in the hand and Kebble drops the wrench. Quinn knocks him out.

Dialogue.Line: Are you all right?
Well done! Who was the man who went outside just now?
Valmar. He's been working for the Daleks.
On their static power supply.
Doctor, they've got Ben.
Yes, I know. He ran away so that I could. Oh well, it's a long story. But don't worry, that boy can take care of himself.
Did you hear that? That won't help.
Get out, all of you!
What about you?
But Doctor!
Go!

Dialogue.Stage Direction: Polly and Quinn and Polly run out into the corridor. The Doctor picks up the wrench and follows, slamming the lab doors behind him and jamming the wrench through the handles. The Dalek cannot follow.

Dialogue.Line: Have they escaped?
Yes, return to capsule and report. DALEK 2: I obey.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: The Dalek fires its gun at the door. The door buckles and gives way, and the Dalek leaves.

Dialogue.Line: We are to wait here until the human beings fight among themselves. DALEK 2: Then we will strike.
And exterminate!

Exterminate! Exterminate! Exterminate! Exterminate! Exterminate! Exterminate! Exterminate! Exterminate! Exterminate! Exterminate! Exterminate! Exterminate! Exterminate! Exterminate! Exterminate! Exterminate! Exterminate!

Dialogue.Stage Direction: The Doctor, Quinn and Polly discover Hensall's body.

Dialogue.Line: The one man who could have saved us.
Don't worry. The people will follow you, too.

Maybe. But there wasn't any maybe about Hensell. He was old-fashioned, single-minded, yes, but he's done a lot of wonderful work for this colony. Events turned out against him, that's all. But why? Why was he killed?
I can answer that.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: Bragen is flanked by armed guards.

Dialogue.Line: He wanted to destroy the Daleks, so one of them killed him. Now I'm declaring martial law. You will be returned to prison and properly guarded this time.
Martial law? What good do you think that will do against the Daleks?
The Daleks will do as I tell them.
We shall see, shan't we.
Take them away.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: Bragen has the corpse removed.

Dialogue.Line: Take up positions, ready to exterminate all human beings. DALEK 3: Exterminate!
Exterminate! Exterminate! Exterminate! Exterminate!

Dialogue.Stage Direction: Two guards are escorting the Doctor, Polly and Quinn to the detention area. The Doctor stops. A Dalek has taken up position ahead of them.

Dialogue.Line: Move on!
The Dalek!
What about it?
Can't you see it's armed?
Keep moving!

Dialogue.Stage Direction: The Dalek bars their way.

Dialogue.Line: This area is restricted.
On whose authority?
Silence!
Repeat. This area is restricted.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: Another Dalek appears behind them.

Dialogue.Line: Obey or you shall be exterminated.
I thought they obeyed us?
What do we do now, Doctor?
This way.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: The Doctor and Polly follow Quinn, with the guards following.

Dialogue.Line: They will be exterminated.
We've won. The revolution's over. I'll pass the word to Valmar, Kebble and the rest.
Wait. The revolution is not quite over yet.
What more can we do? Hensell's dead, you're the new Governor. The battle's over.
Not quite. You mentioned Kebble, Valmar and that rabble. Well, now they must be dealt with.
But those are our own men.
Of course.
I don't understand.

Do you think I can ever be secure in that chair while that rabble are still loose? They rebelled against Hensell yesterday. Tomorrow it'll be my turn. Well, let them rebel. Tell them the guards have taken control. Let them attack, and then we can crush them utterly.
You say we.
Yes. We've come a long way together, you and I. Are you going to back down now?
Couldn't you just arrest them?
Everyone must be killed.
Must they all be slaughtered?
All of them.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: Behind Janley, Bragen reaches into a drawer and gets a pistol.

Dialogue.Line: Well, are you still with me?
I suppose so.
Then do as I say.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: Bragen lays the gun on the desk.

Dialogue.Line: I'm glad you agreed with me.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: Valmar was outside and has overheard everything.
The Doctor, Polly and Quinn now have a guard front and rear. An unarmed Dalek appears.

Dialogue.Line: Now!

Dialogue.Stage Direction: Quinn takes out the rear guard. The other guard fires as they rush off, but misses them.

Dialogue.Line: What have you brought me in here for?
Quiet!
Whose side are you on anyway?
I thought I was going to be on the winning side.
What changed your mind?
Bragen. The colony's become too small for him. He wants us out of the way now.
Yeah, well, it often happens that way, mate, when you follow blokes like him.
Look, I'm going to try and get your friends here, if I can. So wait here.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: The communications unit buzzes.

Dialogue.Line: Section one reporting, Governor Bragen.
Yes. GUARD [on monitor]: The rebels are gathering. We've got them under observation.
Don't let them concentrate in large groups. Hit them before they organise. They'll be making their move any time now. GUARD [on monitor]: Right.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: Communication ends. Bragen looks over a document then makes a colony-wide broadcast.

Dialogue.Line: People of Vulcan. This is your new Governor talking to you. I have to announce that Governor Hensell has been murdered by the rebels. I have taken control temporarily until order is restored. People living on the perimeter and in the interior can stay calm. We know who the murderers are.
I shall keep you informed of events as soon as I am able, so listen for the signal to watch your communication sets. That is all.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: The Doctor, Polly and Quinn enter.

Dialogue.Line: Ah! There you are.
Ben!
I knew you'd be all right!
Polly, you okay?
Oh, yes.
Did Valmar find you, then?
Valmar? No.
What's this about Valmar?
Well it seems Bragen's gone power mad. He wants the rebels to revolt, then he can finish them off.
The Daleks won't care who they fight. They'll exterminate every human being on this planet.
Doctor, oh please, let's go back to the Tardis.
Quinn, keep them both here.
Well, wait a minute, Doctor!

Dialogue.Stage Direction: Quinn blocks Ben's way.

Dialogue.Line: All right. All right.
Now what do you think he's up to?
Orders received. Daleks commence extermination.
Exterminate! Exterminate! Exterminate!

Dialogue.Stage Direction: Gunfire is heard everywhere.

Dialogue.Line: Just a minute, Examiner.
All right, hold it!

Dialogue.Stage Direction: The Doctor drops to the floor.

Dialogue.Line: Down everyone!

Dialogue.Stage Direction: A Dalek fires, killing one of the guards. A second guard returns fire but is also killed. The Doctor grabs Kebble and they run off. The Dalek follows.
Valmar is connecting control wires to three Daleks.

Dialogue.Line: Don't come any nearer.
What do you mean?
I overheard your conversation with Bragen. But you can't stand up to the Daleks, so your plan will come to nothing.
Not my plan. Bragen's.
But that's the same thing.
Not any more.
You expect me to believe that?
Look, Val, he was going to kill me too. I came here to do exactly what you've done. Let Bragen see what the Daleks are like. He doesn't know how strong they are. He's got to be stopped.
You will lead us to the middle of your party of human beings.
Yes.
We will fight... for you.
Believe me, Val, it's the only way to save all our lives.
Did you know that the Daleks are duplicating?
Yes.
But we are your friends. DALEK 2: We will serve you. DALEK 3: Take us to the centre of your group.
Can we trust them?
We must! The guards have orders to wipe us out. We must use the Daleks. Come on.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: Kebble has gone.

Dialogue.Line: Doctor!
The window. Does it open?
I don't know.
It had better, or we're done for! Out you go.
What's happening?
The Daleks. They're teeming all over the corridors. We've got to get back to Lesterson's lab.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: Kebble appears in the doorway and is shot in the back by a Dalek. The Doctor gets through the window just as a Dalek enters.

Dialogue.Line: This is Governor Bragen speaking. A group of rebels is attempting to take over the colony. It is the duty of all loyal citizens to help the guards resist. Stay in your homes. Order will be restored. Listen to my bulletins.
The rebels are using the Daleks against our people!
Well, get back and fight! Why do you come running to me? What do you think your guns are for?
Well, the guns don't work against them!
Get back and fight them!

Dialogue.Stage Direction: The rebels have constructed a barricade of boxes. They are shooting at a group of Bragen's guards when Janley and Valmar with their controlled Daleks.

Dialogue.Line: There and there!

Dialogue.Stage Direction: The Dalek fires at the guards.

Dialogue.Line: Over there! No! No! Over there! They're our people!
Cut the Dalek gun off!
No!

Dialogue.Stage Direction: Janley deactivates the control device but the Dalek fires on the rebels.

Dialogue.Line: I told you to cut the gun off!
I did!
You've killed our own people!
We have to dismantle the gun, that's all.
Oh, look at it!
Your usefulness is over.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: A guard appears, firing at the Dalek.

Dialogue.Line: Come on! Quick, Val. Come on!
Doctor, it's stupid to hide in here!
Well, do you fancy your chances outside in the corridor? No thanks.
The answer must be here somewhere.
Shh!

Dialogue.Stage Direction: Hearing Daleks coming from the capsule, Lesterson hides everyone under the workbench.

Dialogue.Line: You must be absolutely quiet. They know everything that's going on. Everything! They even know what you're thinking.
Where do they get their power from, Lesterson?
Ah, I tried to turn the power off, but they were miles ahead of me. Marvellous creatures. You have to admire them.
But we've got to stop them!
Oh, it's too late for that. They're the new species, you see, taking over from homo sapiens. Man's had his day. Finished now.
The static circuit is nearly complete. DALEK 2: Soon we can abandon the power we are using.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: Screams outside.

Dialogue.Line: The humans are being exterminated.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: The two Daleks go into the capsule.

Dialogue.Line: Did you hear that? They're going to use their own power.
The cables they laid. The trick I tried before won't work anymore.
Oh, if that's no good now, we're finished. All we can do is marvel at the creatures who are taking our place.
No!
Come on!
Don't be a fool.
Come on!

Dialogue.Stage Direction: Quinn pulls Valmar to safety as a Dalek appears ahead. Janley shoots at it, but of course she dies.

Dialogue.Line: Take it easy, Polly.
Can't we do anything?! They're murdering everybody, one by one!
You've done all this. Why'd you give them power in the first place?
Well, I could control it, you see. And then Janley got one of her men, Valmar, I think it was, yes, and he rigged up a secret cable. It's carrying power directly from the colony's supply.
Where? Where is it, Lesterson?
Valmar's the only one who can answer that. Or the Daleks of course. They know everything. Yes, you should ask the Daleks.
Then we must find Valmar.
No. You stay here and look after Polly. I'll go.
Come on. This way. (scream)

Dialogue.Stage Direction: The Doctor uses the diversion of two guards fighting a Dalek to get away down the corridor. A woman tries to enter the lab, but is killed in the doorway. Her companion tries to wrestle the Dalek, with the usual result.
Valmar holds Janley's body, and cries.

Dialogue.Line: You'll have to leave her now, Valmar.
She wasn't as bad as you think.
Valmar! Where is the Dalek power?
Get down, both of you!

Dialogue.Stage Direction: As they play dead, a Dalek glides past them looking for signs of life, and moves on.

Dialogue.Line: Valmar. Valmar! Where is the Dalek power supply?
We've got to stop them, Valmar. She's dead. There's nothing you can do for her.
The main cable's inside the capsule, but there's nothing you can do.
There must be some way of cutting off the power!
What makes you think I want to do that? We need more time. I know. A diversion. Bragen's guards. We'll have to use them to keep the Daleks busy. You go to Bragen.

Section One, where's your report? Are you there, Section one? Section two? Section two? Why don't they answer? Can you hear me, Section two? Section three? Oh, why don't they answer? I'm their Governor. Why don't they answer?

Dialogue.Stage Direction: The colony is silent as the grave as the Daleks look for survivors.

Dialogue.Line: This is Bragen speaking. I'm speaking to the Daleks. Daleks, listen to me. I am the Governor. You must work for me. Do not trust the rebels. I will give you whatever you want, but immobilise your guns. This is the Governor speaking.
He's nuts, trying to talk to the Daleks.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: More Daleks leave the capsule and go out into the corridor.

Dialogue.Line: Lesterson, what's in that cupboard?
Nothing. It's quite empty.
Well, come on, Polly, we'll be safe in there, love.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: Ben and Polly hide in the cupboard while Lesterson stays underneath the bench.

Dialogue.Line: Do you hear me, Daleks?! You will obey my orders!
No use, Bragen. The Daleks have stopped obeying your orders.
Guards!
Dead! The Daleks have killed them. You still have your guard units in the interior. How long will it take them to get here?
That depends.
Well, get them!
Well, they will be intercepted by the Daleks.
Exactly! It will draw them away from here and give the Doctor a chance to deal with them.
I refuse to allow my guards to be sacrificed.
In that case the Daleks will destroy everything on this colony.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: Bragen switches on the communications unit.

Dialogue.Line: Guards. This is Bragen speaking. All units will report immediately to the capital. Be prepared to face the rebel Daleks. There. Are you satisfied?
I hope it works.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: The Doctor returns with Valmar.

Dialogue.Line: Ben! Polly!

Dialogue.Stage Direction: Ben and Polly come out of the cupboard.

Dialogue.Line: Doctor, did you hear what Bragen said?
Yes, I did.
Well, I only hope the Daleks do go for the guards.
A lot of the Daleks went out just now.
Good, because we're going inside. Come on, Valmar.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: The Doctor and Valmar go into the capsule and come out with a junction box connected to a lot of cables.

Dialogue.Line: Ben, give us that spare cable over there. Polly, keep watch at the door.
Well, you know what you're doing?
Of course I do.
Well, why can't you just take all the plugs out and cut the power off?
Because I prefer to do it my way!
Look out!

Dialogue.Stage Direction: Everyone takes cover as a Dalek enters. Valmar goes into the capsule with the modified junction box, just missing another Dalek coming out.

Dialogue.Line: Static power is being stored. We can dismantle the human electric system.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: The Doctor starts to edge his way round the room.

Dialogue.Line: The law of the Daleks is in force. DALEK 2: Extermination of humans.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: Lesterson stands up.

Dialogue.Line: Our cables have been moved.
And I could tell you who did it.
What were you doing in there?
I want to help you.
Why?
(like a Dalek) I am your servant.
We do not need humans now.
Ah, but you wouldn't kill me. I gave you life.
Yes, you gave us life.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: So the Dalek kills him. The Doctor plugs his cable into the generator. Nothing happens. The Daleks spot Valmar and turn, while the Doctor pushes every button in sight. Valmar gets through the door just before the Daleks shoot. Ben pulls Polly out of sight. There's an explosion and the Doctor is knocked down. The Daleks lose control, lights flashing and smoke coming from their casings. One powers into the wall and the other bursts into flames.
Everywhere Daleks are affected by the power surge.

Dialogue.Line: There are two
Exterminate! Ah! Ah! Exterminate!

Dialogue.Stage Direction: The corridors fill with smoke from exploding Daleks.

Dialogue.Line: Out of control! Out of Control!

Dialogue.Stage Direction: In the capsule the machinery goes haywire and explosions rip through it.
A Dalek enters, but its dome blows off before it can shoot at them.

Dialogue.Line: What happened to it?
I don't know.
It seems that your friend, the Examiner, was successful after all.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: Quinn relaxes, and Bragen gets the gun off him.

Dialogue.Line: Now I shall restore law and order on this planet.
Not your law, Bragen. That's finished for good.
You'll obey me, or
Your day is over, Bragen. No one will obey you now.
I'm still the Governor, and you will. Valmar!

Dialogue.Stage Direction: A shot rings out, but it is Bragen who falls dead.

Dialogue.Line: He was a murderer.
Enough of guns. There's a lot of clearing up to be done. We will rebuild together. What is the extent of the damage?
Oh, I don't know if its repairable. The whole electrical system.
Are you all right?
Oh, he's okay. The clot knocked himself out.
It's a miracle. How did you do it?
Eh? What happened? What did I do? What did I do?
You destroyed the Daleks, that's what you did.
No need to be modest about it.
Did I do that?
You know you did.
You used the power from the colony's electric supply, overfed it and blew up their temporary static circuit. Well, didn't you?
Did I do all that?
You may have stopped the Daleks, but have you any idea of the damage you've done to the colony?
Oh. There was a blow back, was there?
A blow back? Our power supply has been destroyed! It'll be months before we can get things back to normal.
Valmar!
Oh, that is unfortunate.
But did it have to be this way?
I did a lot of damage, did I?
Come on.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: Valmar and Quinn go to check the capsule.

Dialogue.Line: I think we'd better get out of here before they send us the bill.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: The Doctor and his companions walk to the Tardis. The Doctor is playing his recorder.

Dialogue.Line: Well, I mean I didn't expect the brass bands to be playing, but I wouldn't have thought a thank you would have hurt anybody.
But Ben, think of all those poor people all killed.
I know, but the Doctor saved the colony from being completely wiped out.
Hmm.
Yeah, and he was telling them all along, but would they listen?
Mind you, he wasn't very convincing when he was trying to explain it to Valmar and Quinn and everybody.
No, he wasn't, was he?
Doctor, you did know what you were doing, didn't you?

Dialogue.Stage Direction: The Doctor just chuckles and gives Polly a wink. There is a Dalek next to the Tardis, its casing melted and scorched.

Dialogue.Line: Oh, you needn't worry about them anymore, Doctor. Just a heap of old iron now.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: Ben taps the Dalek casing and they all go into the Tardis. Moments later it dematerialises and the Dalek's eye-stalk lifts as if to watch.
